title: The Music child. Parts 1 and 2
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Education - Experimental methods
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Activity programs in education
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Education - Study and teaching
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Children - Language
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Handicapped children - Development
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Children - Language
description: Shows the possibilities that exist for eliciting language, basic communication and relationship activity with handicapped children through a special type of music therapy based on live musical improvisation. Gives a comprehensive overview of this special technique in a wide variety of situations with children at various levels of development.
